thread.title: Man United news: Why Alex Ferguson passed up Henrikh Mkhitaryan transfer | Metro News
thread.title_full: Man United news: Why Alex Ferguson passed up Henrikh Mkhitaryan transfer | Metro News

author: Chris Davie For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Man United news: Why Alex Ferguson passed up Henrikh Mkhitaryan transfer | Metro News
text:
Chris Davie for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 22 Feb 2017 2:09 pm Henrikh Mkhitaryan was on Sir Alex Ferguson’s radar at Manchester United. (Getty Images) 
Former Manchester United coach Rene Meulensteen has revealed that Sir Alex Ferguson opted against signing Henrikh Mkhitaryan during his time at Old Trafford. Keep smiling! Mourinho of all people melts hearts with touching message to Ranieri 
The Armenian endured a tough start to life at United following his £27 million arrival from Borussia Dortmund last summer but has been one of Jose Mourinho’s standout stars in recent weeks. 
Meulensteen, who left Old Trafford after Ferguson’s exit, claims Mkhitaryan was on the Scot’s radar but felt the midfielder was not ready for a move to the Premier League. 
‘When he was much younger, before he joined Dortmund, we were actually looking at him. I remember the name very clearly!’ Meulensteen told talkSPORT. Mkhitaryan has been a key figure for Mourinho in recent weeks. (Getty Images)
